articles.author: Jason Lange
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris opened up a marginal two-percentage-point lead over Republican Donald Trump after President Joe Biden ended his re-election campaign and passed the torch to her, a Reuters/Ipsos poll found.
articles.title: Exclusive: Harris leads Trump 44% to 42% in US presidential race, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told families of hostages held in Gaza that a deal that would secure their loved ones' release could be nearing, his office said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Israel's Netanyahu says deal could be nearing for hostages in Gaza

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Bangladesh partially restored telecommunication services on Wednesday although internet connection was slow and social media remained suspended, days after deadly protests against reservations for government jobs killed almost 150 people.
articles.title: Bangladesh partially restores telecommunication services as protests taper off

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The death toll from two landslides in southern Ethiopia has jumped to 229 and could rise further as the search for survivors and casualties continued into a second day, a government official said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Death toll from Ethiopian landslides jumps to 229, official says

articles.author: Lucy Craymer
articles.description: Moeapulu Frances Tagaloa was repeatedly abused from the age of five to seven by a popular Catholic brother who taught at a school which neighboured the Catholic primary she attended in Auckland, New Zealand.
articles.title: Survivors recount trauma as New Zealand releases child abuse report

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Germany's interior ministry said on Wednesday it has banned the association Islamic Centre Hamburg (IZH) and its subsidiary organisations, saying it pursues radical Islamist goals.
articles.title: Germany bans Muslim association for pursuing radical Islamism

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim
articles.description: North Korean balloons carrying trash have landed near South Korea's presidential office, the Presidential Security Service said on Wednesday.
articles.title: North Korean trash balloons land near South Korea's presidential complex

articles.author: Kanishka Singh, Allende Miglietta
articles.description: U.S. Capitol Police arrested Jewish activists protesting against U.S. military support for Israel inside a congressional building on Tuesday, a day before Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is scheduled to deliver a speech to Congress.
articles.title: Jewish activists arrested during Gaza war protest in US Congress building

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An explosion at a Jose Cuervo tequila plant in central Mexico killed at least two people and forced the evacuation of workers and tourists from the area in the spirit's hometown of Tequila, the head of the state's emergency services said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Blast at Jose Cuervo plant in Mexico's Tequila kills at least two people

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippines has ordered foreigners working in offshore gambling firms to leave the country in two months' time, its immigration bureau said on Wednesday, following President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.'s decision to stamp out the operators.
articles.title: Philippines orders foreign workers in offshore gaming hubs to leave in 2 months
